description: Normalized volume of Birkhoff polytope of n X n doubly-stochastic square matrices. If the volume is v(n), then a(n) = ((n-1)^2)! * v(n) / n^(n-1).
comments: The Birkhoff polytope is an (n-1)^2-dimensional polytope in n^2-dimensional space; its vertices are the n! permutation matrices.Is a(n) divisible by n^2 for all n>=4? - _Dean Hickerson_, Nov 27 2002
references: Jesus A. De Loera, Fu Liu, and Ruriko Yoshida, A generating function for all semi-magic squares and the volume of the Birkhoff polytope, J. Algebraic Combin. 30 (2009), no. 1, 113-139. Also http://www.emis.ams.org/journals/JACO/Volume30_1/m6627810x2013373.fulltext.pdf
R. P. Stanley, Decompositions of rational convex polytopes, Annals of Discrete Math. 6 (1980), 333-342.
links: Matthias Beck and Dennis Pixton, The Ehrhart polynomial of the Birkhoff polytope
Beck, Matthias. Stanley's Major Contributions to Ehrhart Theory, arXiv preprint arXiv:1407.0255 (2014).
Matthias Beck and Dennis Pixton, The Ehrhart polynomial of the Birkhoff polytope, Discrete Comput. Geom. 30 (2003), no. 4, 623-637, arXiv:math.CO/0202267
C. S. Chan and D. P. Robbins, On the volume of the polytope of doubly stochastic matrices, math.CO/9806076.
C. S. Chan and D. P. Robbins, On the volume of the polytope of doubly stochastic matrices, Exper. Math. 8 (1999), 291-300.
example: a(2)=1: The polytope of 2 X 2 matrices is the line segment from (1,0;0,1) to (0,1;1,0), with length v(2)=2, so a(2) = 1! * 2 / 2^1 = 1.
crossrefs: Numerator and denominator of v(n) are in A078524 and A078525.
